section.title: The Plot Area
section.para: The plotarea element indicates a rectangular region inside the graph window where the data will be plotted. This region is used as another clipping rectangle --- all data plots shown in the graph are clipped to this rectangle. Things other than data plots that multigraph draws, such as axes, labels, titles, legends, etc., can appear outside (or inside) the plotarea (these other things are clipped to the padding box as described in .
It accepts the following attributes, which represent offsets relative to the padding area defined in the window element:

listitem.para: Offset from the bottom side. Default: 30.
Offset from the left side. Default: 30.
Offset from the top side. Default: 10.
Offset from the right side. Default: 30.

section.para: The padding box and plotarea both serve as clipping regions for various parts of the picture that multigraph draws. The relationship between these two regions, and how they relate to the window (the "div" region in the containing HTML page), is shown in ; in this figure the padding box is white and the plotarea is green. The padding box serves as the clipping region for everything that multigraph draws, other than the border. This includes axes, labels, legends, etc. The plotarea, which is inside the padding box, is the clipping region for data plots.
There can be at most one plotarea element in a &mugl; file. If it is absent, all attributes assume their default values.
